  • All Known Subinterfaces:

    public interface manageEntitlementRule

    • Method Detail

      • manageEntitlementRule

        org.w3c.dom.Document manageEntitlementRule(YFSEnvironment env,
                                           org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                    throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                           java.rmi.RemoteException

        manageEntitlementRule provides ability to create/modify/delete Entitlement Rule data.

        The default behavior of the manageEntitlementRule API is to create a new entitlement rule if the specified rule does not exist, or modify the rule if it does. This is the same as passing Action as Manage. Pass Create or Modify in the Action attribute to use a specific behavior. Additionally, Delete may be passed to delete an entitlement rule.

        Configuring Entitlement Rules

        Entitlement rules allow organizations to manage access to their items. There are two different types of entitlement rules:

        • Customer Entitlements - An enterprise manages these rules and assigns them to its customers.
        • Selling Entitlements - A catalog organization manages these rules and assigns them to organizations, which are referring to it as their catalog organization.

        Customer entitlement rules can be based on one or more of the following:

        • Category - This indicates that the rule applies to all items under the category.
        • Attribute value - This indicates that the rule applies to all items with the assigned attribute value.
        • Set of items - This indicates that the rule applies to all items within the set of items.

        Selling Entitlement rules can only be based on categories.

        Each item entitlement rule can consist of one or more item entitlement rule details, with a sequence number and inclusion/exclusion indicator assigned to each detail. The sequence number is used to determine the order in which the rule details should get applied.

        Assigning Entitlement Rules

        Customer entitlement rules can either be directly assigned to a customer or can be assigned dynamically at the following higher levels:

        • Customer Type
        • Relationship Type
        • Customer Level
        • Vertical
        • Region
        To assign customer entitlement rules inherited from another enterprise, manageEntitlementRuleAssignment API must be used.

        Selling entitlement rules can only be assigned directly to an organization.

        Multiple rules assigned to a customer or an organization are not evaluated in any particular order. The sequence only applies to individual rules at the detail level. If more than one rule is assigned, the customer or organization is entitled to combination of all items included in each rule.

        Applying Entitlement Logic

        For customer entitlements, item entitlement logic is applied while obtaining a list of items based on the item entitlement rules assigned to the customer and the Item Entitlement Strategy business rule. An enterprise can specify the Item Entitlement Strategy business rule with the following values:

        • 01 - Item entitlement logic is enforced base on the item entitlement rules assigned to the customer.
        • 02 - Item entitlement logic is enforced base on the pricelists assigned to the customer.
        • 03 - Item entitlement logic is enforced base on the intersection of item entitlement rules and pricelists assigned to the customer. This indicates that only the entitled items with valid price assigned will be presented to the customers.
        • 04 - Ignore item entitlement logic.

        Selling entitlements are always applied regardless of the Item Entitlement Strategy.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised:
        None.


    Audits: None

    Pre Conditions: None

    Post Conditions: None

    Output Template Support: Yes

    Database Extensibility Support: No

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains the details of Entitlement Rule data. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
